channel.title: Half Life - Mods and their icons
channel.description:
Ok guys.. I have about 40 HL mods and yet when I open my steam interface, none of them have icons to the left. Why? Oh wait a sec... the new and improved Poke 646: Vengeance has an icon! Alas, I cannot figure out how this half life one mod has an icon yet none of the others do.
I have searched and cant find how it is done. For example: Azure sheep. I took the AzureSheep.ico icon, shrunk it down to 16x16, named it identical to the directory name with the extension of tga but my steam interface does not show the azure sheep icon.
So... how do you guys assign an icon to the mod line item/name within the steam interface?

item.title: Half Life - Mods and their icons
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I had the distinguished pleasure of gaining assistance from another gamer that likes his steam list nice and tidy WITH icons next to the HL Mods. Marc Schröder; the Project Lead of Poke 646: Vendetta was happy to help me.

  1. Open the “liblist.gam” file for each mod (found in the root
    of the mod’s folder) with a text editor (such as Notepad)
  2. Add the following line to the file and save it.

icon “your_icon_name”

  1. Place a 16x16px TGA named “your_icon_name.tga” in the rood mod folder.
    (the name can be really anything you desire as long as it matches the
    given name in the liblist.gam)
  2. Launch steam to see your new icon showing.

This was a feature added with Steam so most pre-Steam mods don’t use it, even if they released a later Steam compatibility patch.
